alert.note: Alert for Ashtabula Inland; Ashtabula Lakeshore; Lake (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 24 at 6:39AM EST until December 24 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON EST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills occurring. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph causing blowing and drifting snow. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low 10 to 20 below zero. * WHERE...Lake, Ashtabula Inland and Ashtabula Lakeshore counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 10 AM EST this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM EST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to noon EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Visibilities drop to 1/2 mile to a mile at times, impacting travel along I-90. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A fresh light coating of snow and winds expected to increase slightly through mid morning will continue to cause blowing and drifting snow. Visibilities drop to 1/2 mile to a mile at times, impacting travel along I-90. Locations along the lakeshore should have the strongest wind gusts.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
